00091 typedef unsigned long xnarch_cpumask_t;
00092 #define xnarch_num_online_cpus()         XNARCH_NR_CPUS
00093 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            ((1<<xnarch_num_online_cpus()) - 1)
00094 #define xnarch_cpu_set(cpu, mask)        ((mask) |= 1 << (cpu))
00095 #define xnarch_cpu_clear(cpu, mask)      ((mask) &= 1 << (cpu))
00096 #define xnarch_cpus_clear(mask)          ((mask) = 0UL)
00097 #define xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, mask)      (!!((mask) & (1 << (cpu))))
00098 #define xnarch_cpus_and(dst, src1, src2) ((dst) = (src1) & (src2))
00099 #define xnarch_cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)  ((mask1) == (mask2))
00100 #define xnarch_cpus_empty(mask)          ((mask) == 0UL)
00101 #define xnarch_cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)       (1 << (cpu)) 
00102 #define xnarch_first_cpu(mask)           (ffnz(mask))
00103 #define XNARCH_CPU_MASK_ALL              (~0UL)
00104 
00105 #define xnarch_ullmod(ull,uld,rem)   ((*rem) = ((ull) % (uld)))
00106 #define xnarch_uldivrem(ull,uld,rem) ((u_long)xnarch_ulldiv((ull),(uld),(rem)))
00107 #define xnarch_uldiv(ull, d)         xnarch_uldivrem(ull, d, NULL)
00108 #define xnarch_ulmod(ull, d)         ({ u_long _rem;                    \
00109                                         xnarch_uldivrem(ull,d,&_rem); _rem; })
00110 
00111 static inline int xnarch_imuldiv(int i, int mult, int div)
00112 {
00113     unsigned long long ull = (unsigned long long) (unsigned) i * (unsigned) mult;
00114     return ull / (unsigned) div;
00115 }
00116 
00117 static inline unsigned long long __xnarch_ullimd(unsigned long long ull,
00118                                                  u_long m,
00119                                                  u_long d) {
00120 
00121     unsigned long long mh, ml;
00122     u_long h, l, mlh, mll, qh, r, ql;
00123 
00124     h = ull >> 32; l = ull & 0xffffffff; /* Split ull. */
00125     mh = (unsigned long long) h * m;
00126     ml = (unsigned long long) l * m;
00127     mlh = ml >> 32; mll = ml & 0xffffffff; /* Split ml. */
00128     mh += mlh;
00129     qh = mh / d;
00130     r = mh % d;
00131     ml = (((unsigned long long) r) << 32) + mll; /* assemble r and mll */
00132     ql = ml / d;
00133 
00134     return (((unsigned long long) qh) << 32) + ql;
00135 }
00136 
00137 static inline long long xnarch_llimd(long long ll, u_long m, u_long d) {
00138     if(ll < 0)
00139         return -__xnarch_ullimd(-ll, m, d);
00140     return __xnarch_ullimd(ll, m, d);
00141 }
00142 
00143 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ullmul(unsigned long m1,
00144                                                unsigned long m2) {
00145     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00146 }
00147 
00148 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00149                                                 unsigned long uld,
00150                                                 unsigned long *rem)
00151 {
00152     if (rem)
00153         *rem = ull % uld;
00154 
00155     return ull / uld;
00156 }
00157 
00158 static inline unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long word) {
00159     return ffs((int)word) - 1;
00160 }

00167 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00168 
00169     const char *name;           /* Symbolic name of thread (can be NULL) */
00170     struct xnthread *thread;    /* VM thread pointer (opaque) */
00171     void *khandle;              /* Kernel handle (opaque) */
00172     void (*entry)(void *);      /* Thread entry */
00173     void *cookie;               /* Thread cookie passed on entry */
00174     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00175     jmp_buf rstenv;             /* Restart context info */
00176     pid_t ppid;
00177     int syncflag;
00178     pthread_t thid;
00179 
00180     /* The following fields are not used by the Fusion skin, however
00181        they are set by the nucleus. */
00182     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00183     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00184 
00185 } xnarchtcb_t;

00208 static inline int __attribute__ ((unused))
00209 xnarch_read_environ (const char *name, const char **ptype, void *pvar)
00210 
00211 {
00212     char *value;
00213 
00214     if (*ptype == NULL)
00215         return 0;       /* Already read in */
00216 
00217     value = getenv(name);
00218 
00219     if (!value)
00220         return -1;
00221 
00222     if (**ptype == 's')
00223         *((char **)pvar) = value;
00224     else
00225         *((int *)pvar) = atoi(value);
00226 
00227     *ptype = NULL;
00228 
00229     return 1;
00230 }
00231 
00232 static int inline xnarch_lock_irq (void) {
00233 
00234     return xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqlock,1);
00235 }
00236 
00237 static inline void xnarch_unlock_irq (int x) {
00238 
00239     extern int uvm_irqpend;
00240 
00241     if (!x && uvm_irqlock)
00242         {
00243         if (xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqpend,0))
00244             __pthread_release_uvm(&uvm_irqlock);
00245         else
00246             uvm_irqlock = 0;
00247         }
00248 }

00262 int uvm_irqlock = 0;
00263 
00264 int uvm_irqpend = 0;
00265 
00266 void xnarch_sync_irq (void)
00267 
00268 {
00269     if (uvm_irqlock)
00270         __pthread_hold_uvm(&uvm_irqpend);
00271 }

00334 static void xnarch_restart_handler (int sig) {
00335 
00336     longjmp(uvm_current->rstenv,1);
00337 }
00338 
00339 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00340 
00341 {
00342     struct sigaction sa;
00343     int err;
00344 
00345     if (geteuid() !=0)
00346         {
00347         fprintf(stderr,"This program must be run with root privileges.\n");
00348         exit(1);
00349         }
00350 
00351     err = __fusion_sys_init();
00352 
00353     if (err)
00354         {
00355         fprintf(stderr,"sys_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00356         exit(2);
00357         }
00358 
00359     err = __fusion_skin_init();
00360 
00361     if (err)
00362         {
00363         fprintf(stderr,"skin_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00364         exit(3);
00365         }
00366 
00367     err = __fusion_user_init();
00368 
00369     if (err)
00370         {
00371         fprintf(stderr,"user_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00372         exit(4);
00373         }
00374 
00375     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_restart_handler;
00376     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00377     sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
00378     sigaction(XNARCH_SIG_RESTART,&sa,NULL);
00379 
00380     for (;;)
00381         __pthread_idle_uvm(&uvm_irqlock);
00382 
00383     __fusion_user_exit();
00384     __fusion_skin_exit();
00385     __fusion_sys_exit();
00386 
00387     exit(0);
00388 }
00389 
00390 #endif  /* !XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00418 
00419 #ifdef XENO_POD_MODULE
00420 
00421 extern void *uvm_timer_handle;
00422 
00423 xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;
00424 
00425 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_root;
00426 
00427 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_current;
00428 
00429 struct xnarch_tick_parms {
00430     time_t sec;
00431     long nsec;
00432     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00433     pid_t ppid;
00434     int syncflag;
00435 };
00436 
00437 /*
00438  * NOTE: System-level shadow priorities underlying the UVM threads are
00439  * defined as follows:
00440  *
00441  * - uvm-root = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO)
00442  * - uvm-<user> = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1(waiting) or 2(running)
00443  * - uvm-timer = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 3
00444  */
00445 
00446 static void *xnarch_timer_thread (void *cookie)
00447 
00448 {
00449     struct xnarch_tick_parms *p = (struct xnarch_tick_parms *)cookie;
00450     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00451     struct sched_param param;
00452     struct timespec ts;
00453 
00454     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 3;
00455     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00456 
00457     /* Copy the following values laid in our parent's stack before it
00458        is unblocked from the sync barrier by pthread_create_rt(). */
00459     ts.tv_sec = p->sec;
00460     ts.tv_nsec = p->nsec;
00461     tickhandler = p->tickhandler;
00462 
00463     pthread_create_rt("uvm-timer",NULL,p->ppid,&p->syncflag,&uvm_timer_handle);
00464     pthread_barrier_rt();       /* Wait for start. */
00465 
00466     for (;;)
00467         {
00468         nanosleep(&ts,NULL);
00469         xnarch_sync_irq();
00470         tickhandler();
00471         }
00472 
00473     return NULL;
00474 }
00475 
00476 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long nstick,
00477                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00478 {
00479     struct xnarch_tick_parms parms;
00480     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00481     pthread_t thid;
00482     int err;
00483 
00484     if (nstick == 0) /* UVM does not provide oneshot timing. */
00485         return -ENODEV;
00486 
00487     /* However, if oneshot timing is available at system level, use it
00488        so that we can provide a better resolution for virtual machine
00489        ticks. Otherwise, ask for plain periodic mode, hoping that the
00490        period given will be compatible with Linux's own requirements
00491        wrt its jiffy-based timer. */
00492 
00493 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER
00494     err = pthread_start_timer_rt(0);
00495 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER */
00496     err = pthread_start_timer_rt(nstick);
00497 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_APERIODIC_TIMER */
00498 
00499     if (err)
00500         return err;
00501 
00502     parms.sec = nstick / 1000000000;
00503     parms.nsec = nstick % 1000000000;
00504     parms.tickhandler = tickhandler;
00505     parms.syncflag = 0;
00506     parms.ppid = getpid();
00507 
00508     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00509     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00510     pthread_create(&thid,&thattr,&xnarch_timer_thread,&parms);
00511     pthread_sync_rt(&parms.syncflag);
00512     pthread_start_rt(uvm_timer_handle);
00513 
00514     return 0;
00515 }
00516 
00517 static inline void xnarch_leave_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00518 }
00519 
00520 static inline void xnarch_enter_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00521 }
00522 
00523 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00524                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00525 {
00526     uvm_current = in_tcb;
00527     __pthread_activate_uvm(in_tcb->khandle,out_tcb->khandle);
00528 }
00529 
00530 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00531                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00532 {
00533     uvm_current = next_tcb;
00534     __pthread_cancel_uvm(dead_tcb->khandle,next_tcb->khandle);
00535 }
00536 
00537 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00538 
00539 {
00540     __pthread_cancel_uvm(dead_tcb->khandle,NULL);
00541 }
00542 
00543 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00544                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00545                                          const char *name)
00546 {
00547     struct sched_param param;
00548     int err;
00549 
00550     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00551     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00552     err = pthread_info_rt(&uvm_info);
00553 
00554     if (err)
00555         {
00556         fprintf(stderr,"UVM init failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00557         exit(1);
00558         }
00559 
00560     pthread_init_rt("uvm-root",tcb,&tcb->khandle);
00561     tcb->name = name;
00562     uvm_root = uvm_current = tcb;
00563 }
00564 
00565 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00566 
00567     tcb->khandle = NULL;
00568 }
00569 
00570 static void *xnarch_thread_trampoline (void *cookie)
00571 
00572 {
00573     xnarchtcb_t *tcb = (xnarchtcb_t *)cookie;
00574     struct sched_param param;
00575 
00576     if (!setjmp(tcb->rstenv))
00577         {
00578         param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1;
00579         sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00580         pthread_create_rt(tcb->name,tcb,tcb->ppid,&tcb->syncflag,&tcb->khandle);
00581         pthread_barrier_rt();   /* Wait for start. */
00582         }
00583 
00584     xnarch_setimask(tcb->imask);
00585 
00586     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->thread);
00587 
00588     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00589 
00590     return NULL;
00591 }
00592 
00593 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00594                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00595                                        void *cookie,
00596                                        int imask,
00597                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00598                                        char *name)
00599 {
00600     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00601 
00602     if (tcb->khandle)   /* Restarting thread */
00603         {
00604         pthread_kill(tcb->thid,XNARCH_SIG_RESTART);
00605         return;
00606         }
00607 
00608     tcb->imask = imask;
00609     tcb->entry = entry;
00610     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00611     tcb->thread = thread;
00612     tcb->name = name;
00613     tcb->ppid = getpid();
00614     tcb->syncflag = 0;
00615 
00616     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00617     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00618     pthread_create(&tcb->thid,&thattr,&xnarch_thread_trampoline,tcb);
00619 
00620     pthread_sync_rt(&tcb->syncflag);
00621 }
00622

00635 int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00636 
00637 {
00638     spl_t s;
00639     splhigh(s);
00640     splexit(!!imask);
00641     return !!s;
00642 }

00661 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00662 
00663 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00664 
00665 extern xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;
00666 
00667 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long tsc) {
00668 
00669     nanostime_t ns;
00670     return pthread_tsc2ns_rt(tsc,&ns) ? 0 : ns;
00671 }
00672 
00673 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00674 
00675     nanostime_t tsc;
00676     return pthread_ns2tsc_rt(ns,&tsc) ? 0 : tsc;
00677 }
00678 
00679 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void)
00680 
00681 {
00682     nanotime_t t;
00683     pthread_time_rt(&t);
00684     return t;
00685 }
00686 
00687 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_tsc (void)
00688 
00689 {
00690     nanotime_t t;
00691     pthread_cputime_rt(&t);
00692     return t;
00693 }
00694 
00695 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00696     return uvm_info.cpufreq;
00697 }
00698 
00699 static inline void xnarch_halt (const char *emsg) {
00700     fprintf(stderr,"UVM fatal: %s\n",emsg);
00701     fflush(stderr);
00702     exit(99);
00703 }
00704 
00705 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes) {
00706     return malloc(bytes);
00707 }
00708 
00709 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes) {
00710     free(chunk);
00711 }

00719 #define xnarch_free_stack  xnfree
